title: Great Horror Stories (gnv64)
description:
Great Horror Stories
By Various Authors
Chancellor Press | 2002 | ISBN: 0753705699 | PDF | 638 pages | 20.3 mb
scanned to PDF by me.

Previously published as 'The Great Book of Thrillers' (1936) by Odhams Press Ltd & as 'Great Tales of Terror' (1991) by Chancellor Press. There are hairbreadth escapes and dangerous living; murder in Park Lane and on the Riviera; resuscitations from the grave; detectives and super-detectives - Dr Thorndyke, Malcom Sage and The Old Man in the Corner to name but a few. There is fine imaginative writing ranging from delicate fantasy to stark tragedy and the macabre. Enjoy the imaginative works of Dickens, Poe, Balzac, Marjorie Bowen and Baroness Orczy among others. But beware, once you open its pages, Great Horror Stories is a book you will not want to put down.
